intro: Vochysia rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed velvetwood, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Chrysobalanaceae and is characterized by its smooth, reddish-brown bark and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by woody, egg-shaped fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
